list_definition.definition: (an instance of) unfairness or the lack of justice

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He complained of injustice in the way he had been treated
They agreed that an injustice had been committed.

Their justifications for the public sector rested on the injustices of material inequalities, the oppressions of industrial power, and the inefficiencies of market failure.
But this injustice is part of a more global picture, keenly felt and bitterly expressed at the local level.
How far back must one go in wiping clean the historical slate of injustices?
